sn41.8:5.9: See BB’s note for the peculiar grammar of this phrase. I take it as an idiom,. and try to express it in a way that makes sense in English. Note also that the peculiar context of this, where Citta, normally so precise in his questions, throws in a random set of dhammas and then leaves, echoes the similar passage at AN 10.27. There, the Buddha, equally randomly, says that this set of questions would stump any sectarian teacher.
sn41.8:5.19: This whole passage is, I think, Pali for: “You are so pwned. Delete your account.”
